Package main.java.meetings

Class MeetingManager

java.lang.Object
main.java.meetings.MeetingManager
public class MeetingManager extends Object
The MeetingManager class calculates the priority of a meeting.
Since:
2023-05-11
Version:
1.0
Author:
Zac Healy

  • Method Details

    • validAttendees

      public boolean validAttendees(int numOfPeople)
      Checks if the given number of attendees is valid or not.

      Side-effect free. Referentially transparent.

      Parameters:
      numOfPeople - The number of people attending the meeting.
      Returns:
      true if the number of attendees is valid.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the number of attendees is less than 5.

    • isUrgencyValid

      public boolean isUrgencyValid(int urgency)
      Checks if the urgency is valid.

      Side-effect free. Referentially transparent.

      Parameters:
      urgency - The urgency of the meeting.
      Returns:
      false if urgency is invalid, true otherwise.

    • isUrgencyBelowThreshold

      public boolean isUrgencyBelowThreshold(int urgency)
      Checks if the urgency level is below a certain threshold.

      Side-effect free. Referentially transparent.

      Parameters:
      urgency - The urgency level of the meeting.
      Returns:
      true if the urgency level is 0, false otherwise.

    • isCapacityReached

      public boolean isCapacityReached(int numOfPeople)
      Checks if the meeting's capacity has been reached.

      Side-effect free. Referentially transparent.

      Parameters:
      numOfPeople - The number of people attending the meeting.
      Returns:
      true if the capacity has been reached, false otherwise.

    • lineManagerFactor

      public int lineManagerFactor(int numUnderManagement)
      Calculates the line manager factor based on the number of people under management.

      Side-effect free. Referentially transparent.

      Parameters:
      numUnderManagement - The number of people under management.
      Returns:
      2 if the number of people under management is less than 5, 1 otherwise.

    • calculatePriority

      public double calculatePriority(int numOfPeople, int numUnderManagement, int urgency)
      Calculates the priority of the meeting based on the number of attendees, the number of people under management, and the urgency level.

      Side-effect free. Not referentially transparent.

      Parameters:
      numOfPeople - The number of people attending the meeting.
      numUnderManagement - The number of people under management.
      urgency - The urgency level of the meeting.
      Returns:
      the calculated priority of the meeting
